intro: Sphaeralcea fendleri subsp. tripartita, commonly known as desert four o'clock, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is characterized by its branching stems and clusters of yellow to orange flowers that bloom in the afternoon. The plant typically grows in arid and semi-arid environments, such as sandy soils and rocky slopes. Its leaves are usually small, hairy, and adapted to reduce water loss. The species is part of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton.
